meanings.definition: The study of the structure and function of bones.
meanings.sent1: In osteologies, we learn about how bones work in our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use osteologies to understand the different bones in animals.
meanings.sent3: The class on osteologies was so interesting that even the skeletons were paying attention.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of osteologies was the backbone of her success in the medical field.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on osteologies was filled with colorful diagrams of bones.

meanings.sent1: Osteologies involves using advanced tools to examine bones closely.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in osteologies often work in laboratories to analyze bone samples.
meanings.sent3: The detective's expertise in osteologies helped solve the mystery of the missing skeleton.
meanings.sent4: The museum's collection of ancient bones was a treasure trove for osteologies enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The professor's passion for osteologies was contagious among the students.

meanings.definition: The branch of anatomy that deals with bones.
meanings.sent1: Studying osteologies requires understanding the different types of bones in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors specializing in osteologies play a crucial role in diagnosing bone-related conditions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about osteologies had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: In the world of osteologies, every bone tells a unique story.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator's expertise in osteologies was evident in the bone exhibits.
